docs.snippet: Uruguay House urges Govt bar fetes

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26 -- The International Materials Conference provided 6,150 tons of newsprint today to six countries otherwise unable to obtain supplies, but said that such "emergency allocations" would have to be replaced in the near future by...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26 -- The International Materials Conference provided 6,150 tons of newsprint today to six countries otherwise unable to obtain supplies, but said that such "emergency allocations" would have to be replaced in the near future by "normal commercial transactions."
docs.abstract: Internal Materials Conf makes emergency allocations of 6,150 tons to 6 countries; says normal commercial transactions will replace such allocations in future; '52 procedure outlined; total allocations to date listed by countries

headline.main: SIX COUNTRIES GET NEWSPRINT STOCKS; International Materials Body Allots Emergency Supplies Aggregating 6,150 Tons

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The advance of the Canadian dollar to parity with American was the biggest single event in the foreign exchange market last week. At this new peak, Canadian stands at its highest since August, 1939, when it sold at par.
docs.lead_paragraph: The advance of the Canadian dollar to parity with American was the biggest single event in the foreign exchange market last week. At this new peak, Canadian stands at its highest since August, 1939, when it sold at par.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Jan. 25, 1952

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 27 -- Economic leadership and mass production methods of the United States are cited by the United Nations statistical yearbook as major factors in tremendous advances registered in world output of important commodities...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 27 -- Economic leadership and mass production methods of the United States are cited by the United Nations statistical yearbook as major factors in tremendous advances registered in world output of important commodities over the last two decades.
docs.abstract: UN statistical yr-book shows big world output rise, '31-50

headline.main: U. S. MASS METHODS AID WORLD OUTPUT; U. N. Yearbook Cites American Economic Leadership as Spur for Production STUDY COVERS 20 YEARS Records Compiled From 250 Countries Show Striking Gains in Some Fields U. S. MASS METHODS AID WORLD OUTPUT

byline.original: By KATHLEEN McLAUGHLINSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 29 -- The Brazilian Government has ordered all state and territorial Governors to prevent a meeting of the allegedly Communist "Continental Peace Congress" anywhere in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 29 -- The Brazilian Government has ordered all state and territorial Governors to prevent a meeting of the allegedly Communist "Continental Peace Congress" anywhere in the country.
docs.abstract: Brazilian Govt bans it; Cong reptdly backed by Brazilian Movement for Peace and Communist leader L E Prestes; adherents to defy ban

headline.main: BRAZIL WIDENS BAN ON PRO-RED RALLY; Instructs Governors to Prohibit 'Peace Congress' Session Anywhere in Country

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Feb. 1 -- A Soviet resolution that in effect called for en bloc admission of fourteen applicants for membership in the United Nations, including five Communist countries, failed of adoption by the General Assembly today as a result of...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Feb. 1 -- A Soviet resolution that in effect called for en bloc admission of fourteen applicants for membership in the United Nations, including five Communist countries, failed of adoption by the General Assembly today as a result of strenuous United States opposition.

headline.main: U. S. Blocks Mass U. N. Entry; Assembly Beats Soviet Move; U. S. BLOCKS SOVIET ON MASS U. N. ENTRY

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Canadian dollar last week suffered its first setback since itq climbed to parity with American, begun about a month ago. London selling which set in on Thursday and carried into Friday, dumped the rate to 90.28 cents from par; the week's final of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian dollar last week suffered its first setback since itq climbed to parity with American, begun about a month ago. London selling which set in on Thursday and carried into Friday, dumped the rate to 90.28 cents from par; the week's final of 99.625 cents, represented a loss of 11/32 cent from the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Feb. 1, 1952.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Wednesday, Feb. 6 -- A widespread plot against the Peron Government has been frustrated by the police with the arrest of Col. Francisco Suarez, retired, a former Army Chief of Staff, and more than 100 other alleged conspirators, it has...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Wednesday, Feb. 6 -- A widespread plot against the Peron Government has been frustrated by the police with the arrest of Col. Francisco Suarez, retired, a former Army Chief of Staff, and more than 100 other alleged conspirators, it has been learned on good authority.
docs.abstract: seize Col F Suarez and over 100 others as alleged plotters; evidence cited; Sept revolt recalled

headline.main: ARGENTINE OFFICER SEIZED AS PLOTTER; Suarez, Ex-Chief of Staff, Among 100 Held in Perons' Assassination Move ARGENTINE OFFICER SEIZED AS PLOTTER

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Feb. 6 -- Forty-seven countries, including Japan, Italy and West Germany, made pledges today that came close to the United Nations goal of $20,000,000 for its 1952 technical assistance program. The United States contribution will be roughly...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Feb. 6 -- Forty-seven countries, including Japan, Italy and West Germany, made pledges today that came close to the United Nations goal of $20,000,000 for its 1952 technical assistance program. The United States contribution will be roughly $12,000,000.
docs.abstract: conf opens, Paris; J Lesage (Canada) elected chmn; 47 countries including Japan, Italy and W Ger make contributions following Sec Gen Lie appeal; US pledges $12 million on condition $20 million is raised; will give 60% of total otherwise; Canada, Australia and Switzerland make similar reservations; Spain makes no pledge; USSR bloc not present; countries and pledges listed

headline.main: U. N. NEAR ITS GOAL ON TECHNICAL AID; West Germany, Japan and Italy Among Donors -- $12,000,000 U. S. Offer Tied to Total
